comments.body: How would you make maroon dye?
How can you craft maroon dye?
Maybe By Puprle And Red Dye?
I guess pink is the light blue dye equivalence to red. It is just a lighter shade of red.
This sounds like a great idea! Maybe fiddle roses can be added so we could craft it via flowers.
Usually I'd question adding things like dirt slabs and the like, but this actually solves a problem in a way that makes sense.
I feel like a bow wouldn't really be suited to this job. Maybe they could add a slingshot for this?

Adding a slingshot would be fun, especially if you could then place the slingshot and have it interact with redstone like a high powered dropper. People would still use the dropper because most of the uses I've seen for the dropper don't exactly launch the item.

Maybe you could place the slingshot on the dropper, and the dropper's texture would change to show that it's rigged with a slingshot, and will really launch items.

For redstone with a lot of items going through, this device would really suck, since items get fired one at a time as entities, so anyone putting one of these on a clock is gonna kill the server. I'm not really suggesting this, but that could be avoided if the device shot entire stacks of its inventory when shot. That would make it less of a dropper and more of a catapult.

Fun times! Could be cool.

I've had this come up in my one friend's realm, he always forgets/ doesn't have stuff when he wants to help and I'll pearl over to drop stuff. What about a shulker you can place like an ender pearl? If I can teleport my PC with all my inventory why can't I toss a shulker box? I can shoot an explosive, colorful firework out of a crossbow but not stick a nether pearl infused shulker bolt into a block from a distance.
Piglins like this.
No bambo should be a blowgun

Yes! I love the idea of classic pitfalls!

However, what would this add to enhance current pitfall methods? We already have berry bushes and wither roses to deal DoT when trapped, so would this be a "Fall and take a bunch of damage one time" thing or yet another DoT thing?
i think using an axe instead of a sword would be more logical, as you chop the bamboo to get the sharp points
Ah yes, the good ol' punji pit. Definitely preferable to surrounding my house with berry bushes. Really want this now
you should use flint insted of a sword

An ore with magnetic properties would be very useful and allow players to make even bigger, and stronger redstone machines. Maybe it would be possible to transport metal objects this way?

Definitely something for Mojang to consider!
Maybe the ore should be magnetite instead of magnesium? Plus in the real world, magnetite typically comes from space, and the end is sort of the "outer space" of Minecraft
If there were other kinds of geodes (ruby, sapphire, ect) they could be used to create colored glass in the same fashion as terracotta
I wouldn't recommend you try it in real life, but how would drinking water extinguish afire that is on the outside of your body?
Good good idea.
Or allow splash water bottles to put out fire?
Or use Splash Water Bottle to extinguish fire on entities.

I feel that this would be great for the nether, but instead of drinking it, it should be a splash water bottle and they should be able to stack. Maybe make them able to put out other entities on fire as well, and could be a feasible weapon against blazes.
you actually can fill a cauldron to place water, but it is still hard to enter the cauldron to not die so i think thats an amazing idea!
I remember that there already is this mechanic...
I came here to post this idea, but it was already here. This feature is a must have. I hate just watching as my my healthbar ticks down and not being able to do anything about it.
Mostafa game over
Halo
i think that it would require like a very rare, exlusively-found-in-end-cities enchantment, so you cant move ur portal without going to end and grind for it
A fear I have would be that a greifer could destroy the portals and then destroy the items
Paul Harrison, strongholds spawn throughout the world, they're just extremely rare. No one could destroy all of the portals in a entire world.
Ender Hosts there are only 128 strongholds in a Java edition world, all within 24,000 blocks of the center. This is completely feasible for a dedicated player to destroy
I would suggest as an alternative a crafting recipe for end portal frames that involves netherite blocks

yes! i think that it should be somthing that you can do in the endgame and make a portal room, and maybe it could be a netherite block in a beacon? because i think netherite should be special for beacons, maybe you could lso need shulker shells to craft it into somthing else?
what if when mined, the tool responsible for mining it is inflicted with a curse?

I definately think that just a netherite pickaxe is way to easy, but i would love there to be at least some way to get the end portal frames in survival. (i.e. you also need full netherite armor or have the dragon egg in your inventory)

Ha ha you already can with this symbol: § along with a letter or a number. §a id light green, §b is a aqua blue, §c is a light red, §1 is dark blue. There are other things the symbol can do. §k is glitch text, §o is italics, §l is bold, and §r is default.
This only works when writing in Minecraft's code. In-game, the symbol § is only allowed in a book and quill.

One more thing. Health boost 1 gives 2 hearts, the second level gives 4 hearts. I think you should make health boost potions using the golden apple and absorption using honeycomb. That seems a bit fair.
I agree that Minecraft could use more defensive blocks, and also a new use for bamboo. Great idea!
Indeed
Yo know you can do the same thing with a trapdoor and a puffer-fish underneath it right
I think instead of using iron to make the table you should use diamond
I think it should be called Chorus Nectar.
Can you get it from enderwasp hives? Sorry if I Sound stupid for not knowing what an enderwasp is...

I feel like the purpur juice should be like juice you get at the end city from the fruit I would have called it the fruit thats in the end but thats just me but I also like the idea and how you make it would be a brewing stand with the fruit. You will however need to get to the end city to get it.
I believe it should have some more different uses compared to honey bottles and chorus fruit. It would be a lot easier to carry honey bottles and chorus fruit on you rather than harvest Purpur juice,
Why carry both chorus fruits and honey when you can just have the two combined in one bottle?

dirty pigs cleaners for dirty pigs and mud. when pigs go into mud they turn dirty pig and cleaners clean dirty pigs. to craft cleaners you need 3 string  and 4 sticks. to craft mud you need three corst dirt and one string.
Nice
They should also add pillager outpost maps

this is a great idea because they're probably rarer than woodland mansions so it would be nice to have maps to be able to find them. I once flew around my survival world for several hours looking for one and i had to just give up and use chunk base to find one. it would also help if they were a little more common.

idea:

chorus cake is placeable like cake, and teleport to any random other chorus cake when a slice is eaten.

chorus fruit teleport player to the cake rather than randomly if a cake is nearby.
I have an idea for sugar to be place able like Redstone which all passive and neutral mobs will natural follow, sorta of like a path for animals. Horses should also like sugar.
Good idea
We should also have sugar cubes instead of sugar piles
I think when in contact with water, the sugar block should instead just dissolve.

Sugar cubes as a block - a great idea. Is the neighbor block wet or water they dissolve, but with a little delay. You can burn caramel from sugar blocks in the oven. This can be processed into candy. Blocks of caramel could be extremely sticky when in contact with water.
So it’s like the pocket edition Minecraft Nether creator but the exact opposite
Great idea.I agree,but it would have planks and all of the variations that others trees has.
Good idea. Some porridge pleade=)
You'd be in luck!
Cool idea, but I think purple fire would fit more in the end instead
Purple Fire should be found on Crying Obsidian. When on fire it would teleport you around
Wait I have en idea get it since im talking about the end? Anyways. I think the purple fire being on crying obsidian would be great, but. It should be on end stone too.

soul arrows should be crafted by surrounding soul sand or soul soil with arrows. These arrows have a brown tip and are on fire only when using flame bows. These arrows should deal more fire damage since soul fire is stronger than regular fire.

I like this, but what if it doesn't light non-soul blocks on fire, like regular campfires, tnt, etc. Would allow you to shoot your fire bow without accidentally setting off tnt if needed. Also gives it a use outside of cool looks.

I would suggest that they be crafted by surrounding one block of soul sand/soul soil with spectral arrows.

I would also say that they can be fired from any bow but take 2 durability or more if the bow does not have flame.
Why just for campfire why not for all wood blocks that just have oak

In addition, you should not be able to make regular Campfire of Crimson and Warped Wood.
This wood should only be used for Soul Campfire, because the wood itself is non-flammable, but the blue fire is hotter.
Campfires have become a super common building block in their unlit form. Having different versions for each wood type would be a great simple addition to the block palate of the game!!!
